Recap: Buzz is about to say goodbye to Company when he finds out from Gus that Company has been saved due to the nesting warbler. Sandy realizes that Tammy's new friend is really Jonathon and goes off in search of Tammy. Reva, who is worried about Sandy, follows him. Tammy meets some of JB's friends. Harley is called and rushes to her house only to find it destroyed. Sandy finds Tammy just in time to see a car headed toward her.
Transcript: Buzz: Well, we've had a good run, old girl. I guess it's time to say good-bye. Sorry I let you down. Thanks for... for...
Harley: Nice, really. Hey, Dad, let me ask you something. Why are all the rest of us going to bother fighting if you're so ready to pack it in?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Gus: Thank you.
Phillip: I'll tell you what. I'll buy the next round to celebrate.
Gus: Yeah, what are we celebrating?
Phillip: You're big victory. You got the injunction that saved Company.
Gus: Oh, no, that wasn't really me. That was the nesting warbler. I just... and I promise I was just trying to make sure that Spaulding didn't get in a lawsuit.
Phillip: I believe you. Well, that's good. You succeeded. Barkeep? Two single malts, please.
Gus: Might be a little hasty, you know, because it's just a little reprieve, I think.

Phillip: No, actually it isn't, Gus. I owe you. Getting that injunction gave me some time to think and I realized I... I made the biggest mistake you could make in business. I let this get personal. So it's over, and I'm glad.
Gus: So you're just going back off Company for good?
Phillip: Absolutely. Time to move on.
Gus: Hmm.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Sandy: Oh, awesome. Hate mail. What? I hope you're enjoying masquerading as Reva's son. My mom seems like quite a lady, so accessible, so vulnerable. I don't take kindly to posers.
Reva: Don't you answer your cell phone anymore?
Sandy: Sorry. I turned it off. I was...
Reva: I was trying to call you to tell you about a lead I got on a story. Some guy contacted me, wouldn't give me his name, but wants to set up a meeting for later.
Sandy: And what's the story?
Reva: Corporate scandal. He wouldn't give me the details on the phone, but he wants to meet alone later for an exclusive.
Sandy: And you're going to meet this complete stranger alone?
Reva: Well, yes. Stories like this don't just land in lap ready for broadcast. You have to get in there and you have to dig.
Sandy: Don't go. I have a bad feeling about this one.
Reva: Then it must be a good story.
Sandy: I'm serious, Reva. Don't go. Not this time.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: JB, Where are you? If he skipped town, I am never going to forgive Aunt Reva.
JB: Don't worry, beautiful, I haven't packed my bags yet.
Tammy: I'm so glad you're here. Glad I found you.
JB: Yeah, well, I'll be in town awhile. And don't worry about auntie I'll make sure she never comes between us again.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Danny: Great. I'll see you then. All right. Thanks. All right.
Michelle: Good news?
Danny: Well, I finally got a job interview at Towers. They called me.
Michelle: That's great.
Danny: Why don't you come with? You can, you know, hang out at the bar and we can catch a drink afterwards.
Michelle: No, I can't. Some guy called. He wants to come over and talk about the lighthouse.
Danny: Why?
Michelle: I don't know. He hung up before I got the chance to find out.
Danny: Well, Michelle, you shouldn't be here alone when he comes over.
Michelle: Good-bye, Danny.
Danny: No. Come on, I'm not being unreasonable. I'll just stick around until we know he's okay.
Michelle: Okay.
Danny: Okay?
Michelle: Okay.
Danny: Thank you.
Michelle: Hey.
Sebastian: Hello.
Michelle: Are you the guy who called?
Sebastian: Yes. Michelle Santos?
Michelle: That's me.
Sebastian: Sebastian Hulce. I can't tell you how good it is to finally meet you. I was close friends with your mother.
Michelle: Really?
Sebastian: Mm-hmm.
Danny: You knew Claire Ramsey?
Sebastian: And you are?
Danny: I'm Danny Santos, Michelle's husband. How well did you know Claire?
Sebastian: I didn't. I knew Maureen Bauer. Actually, you're a lot like her.
Danny: It's interesting that you knew Maureen so well. I never heard of you.

Sebastian: My friendship with Maureen began a few years ago. I moved away and she stayed here and we've always kept in touch. I really regret not seeing her, you know, toward the end. You must miss her terribly.
Danny: Well, I know her family does. Actually, I never met her.
Michelle: And I have a memory thing, you know, from an accident. So if you're here to talk about old times I can't really help you out there, because I don't really remember my mother.
Sebastian: I understand. Actually, I heard about the accident at the warehouse. In fact, that's one of the reasons I'm here. I wanted to see how you were doing.
Michelle: Oh, I'm doing great. It's everybody else who has a problem.
Danny: Michelle says that you're interested in the lighthouse.
Sebastian: Yes, very.
Danny: Why?
Sebastian: Well, it's, you know, it's an historical landmark in this town and I've always dreamed about restoring it and opening it to the public.
Michelle: That's exactly what we're going to do.
Sebastian: Oh, so you're business partners as well as...
Michelle: No, Danny's not my partner. His cousin, Tony Santos is.
Sebastian: I see. Well, you know what? In that case, why don't I come back when the other Mr. Santos is available?
Michelle: Well, you're here now. So why don't you tell me what it is you want to know. And Danny was just leaving anyway.
Sebastian: If you're concerned about leaving your wife here alone with me, I completely understand.
Danny: No, no, no. There are plenty of workmen right outside. Their lunch break is almost over. They'll be up any minute. And I'll be back before you know it, okay?
Michelle: Okay.
Danny: All right.
Sebastian: Well, I look forward to getting to know you better.
Danny: Why? You plan on sticking around?
Sebastian: Yeah, for a while.
Michelle: I'll walk you out. How's that? And I'll be right back.
Danny: Okay.
Sebastian: Okay.
Danny: Nice to meet you.
Sebastian: The same.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: I'm glad I found you.
JB: I wanted you to. How'd you get out of the house without your watchdog?
Tammy: Aunt Reva's just protective. That's all, especially since my mom's away.
JB: Yeah, well, maybe she should protect her own kid, that Sandy guy.
Tammy: Just forget about my family. Can we just spend some time together? Unless you have something else to do.
JB: No. I'll go get us some beers.
Tammy: I'll just have a soda.
JB: All right, whatever you say choirgirl.
Tammy: I'm not used to drinking this early in the day.
JB: From the way that you passed out yesterday, I'd say that you're not used to drinking at all.
Tammy: I was stressed out, okay. That's all it was. And the beers just sort of pushed me over the edge. Are you mad at me?
JB: What, you think I'm not going to like you because you don't drink?
Tammy: I don't know. I'm still trying to figure out what you think, how you feel.
JB: Don't work so hard at it. I thought we had a connection. Maybe I was wrong.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: Sandy, meeting strangers, getting stories, that's my job. It's what I do.
Sandy: What if you're walking into a trap?
Reva: What's got you so spooked?
Sandy: The email that we got. You know, the one threatening you?
Reva: I get hate mail all the time; most reporters do. It's part of the job. People like to vent.
Sandy: But what if it's different this time? Huh? I should go with you.
Reva: No. I told him I'd meet him alone. And if I lose his trust, I lose the story. But I do appreciate your concern. And I will have my cell phone turned on. I promise.
Sandy: That won't help you... Reva, if something were to happen to you and I could have prevented it, don't you understand that I would never forgive myself?
Reva: If I let fear direct me in my choices that I make in life, then I would be off the air and out of job.
Sandy: Finding you and being part of your life, I've never been happier. I just don't want anything to come... Anyone or anything to come in between us.
Reva: Sandy. Hey, hey, hey. Your my son, do you get that? That's a bond that can't be broken. It lasts forever.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Harley: You will hate yourself. You know you will, Dad. If you throw in the towel, you will hate yourself. What Phillip is doing is wrong. And if we let him get away with it, we're saying it's okay.

Buzz: Kiddo, happy endings don't happen because you want them to or because they're right. The Calvary isn't going to come riding in here to save us from the massacre. It's not going to happen. So let's give this gracious lady a good-bye while she's still holding her head high. I don't want to sit on it until she's in rubble. Let's give the old gal a send off she deserves. I'll do water. You do ouzo.
Harley: As long as you know, I've got my fingers crossed behind my back. Make a toast.
Buzz: To Company.
Harley: To Company, original.
Buzz: The last gift from my wife. You kept the family together. You taught me to settle down and embrace the family business.
Harley: You gave us a place to come together again.
Buzz: Imagine that.
Harley: Hmm. (gags)
Buzz: Water?
Harley: Please. (Buzz laughs at Harley)
Buzz: Well, it's all done, but the packing.

Harley: Okay, we may have lost the battle, but we are going to win the war. Right? I'm not going to stand by while Phillip runs rough-shot over us. I won't. What kind of message does that send to my kids? You know, that you could get hit from behind. You just roll over and you wait for the next punch. I can't do that, Dad.
Buzz: So you're going to come out fighting, right?
Harley: Yes.
Buzz: You win, Phil wins. You know it's goes on like that. Where does it end? You're going to raise your kids with a war game like that going on? Is it worth it?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Phillip: It's all there. That's good. My official notification to the state signed and notarized.
Gus: Let me ask you something.
Phillip: Mm-hmm.
Gus: What's making you just all of sudden walk away from Spaulding's hold on the land that's Company's on just like (snaps finger)... Just like that?
Phillip: I told you. It was a mistake. And it's time to move on. Here, by the end of the day Buzz's burger palace will no longer be condemned. Let's drink to it.
Gus: Here's to your change of heart whatever the reason.
Phillip: It had to end. You and damn bird.
Gus: (Laughs)
Phillip: You know it was more than that. All the protest, all the bad PR that we were getting for it.
Gus: Mm-hmm.
Phillip: And Harley started to use it to turn Zach against me. It just had to end.
Gus: Well, you know for whatever it's worth; I think you're doing the right thing.
Phillip: Yeah, I do, too. I'll tell you what. I'm going to let you tell Harley the good news.
Gus: Oh, yeah.
Phillip: You could be the hero.
Gus: Oh, right. A hero. That's what she wants, a Spaulding for a hero.
Phillip: Probably got a point there. Divided loyalties have never worked very well for the Spaulding's anyway, Gus. Oh, you know what? I'm actually meeting somebody.
Gus: Mm-hmm.
Phillip: Can you do me a favor? Can you take care of that for me?
Gus: Yeah, sure. No problem.
Phillip: Great. Thanks.
Gus: Thank you, Phillip, and thank you my little feathered friend.
Phillip: Divided loyalties, Gus. You're either with me or you're not.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Michelle: Wait a minute. What? How much is the roofing material going to cost? Okay. He can't give me a better price then that? I'll wait. Sorry. It's my contractor.
Sebastian: No problem. Take your time. I'm having fun looking around.
Michelle: Yes, I'm here. I'm here. Well that's a lot more then we planned. All right, I'm going to have to run it by Tony. And I'll get back to you. All right. Bye.
Sebastian: Everything all right?
Michelle: Yeah. It's just the price tag on this job just goes up and up... every time we get on the phone.
Sebastian: Well, I'm sure your husband can float you a loan.
Michelle: Yeah, he's not really in the position to do that right now.
Sebastian: Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't realize.
Michelle: No, it's, you know, temporary. He'll be back on top soon.
Sebastian: Hmm. Well, it takes guts to pursue a project like this, you know, especially in light of your husband's financial difficulties.

Michelle: Yeah, well, that's the great part about having no memory, no fear. (both laugh) Anyway, you know, why should I worry? Turn this place into a club and restaurant. It's a money maker anyway you look at it. We'll be turning profit in no time.
Sebastian: Certainly by the end of the second year.
Michelle: No, I think it'll be sooner than that.
Sebastian: I don't know. I've invested in a lot new businesses and that just seems to be the way it is.
Michelle: Well, then I guess I'm going to have to win the lottery in order to put food on these tables.
Sebastian: I have a suggestion. Let me help. I'll buy the place from you--as is--cash.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Buzz: Zach is caught in the push-pull between you and Phillip. And he's a sharp kid. He knows what's happening and it's hurting him. It's not good for Jude either.
Harley: It's not my intention to turn Zach against his father, Daddy.

Buzz: You've been great to him. And you've been more than fair with Phillip. But this war between the two families goes on; I mean you're going to be able to remain impartial? Loving? What about that temper of yours? I mean, when you kiss a girl with pots and pans flying every time Phillip pulls a number on you?
Harley: No, of course, Dad. But what kind of a mother am I if I just let Phillip run rough shod over us, okay? I need to show my boys that mommy doesn't run away from a fight.
Buzz: Like your old man is doing.
Harley: Okay. Well, it's out there. Here we go.

Buzz: Zach and Jude are lucky to have you as their mother. You're a fighter. I know they're safe with you. You've kept food on the table, a roof over their heads and that's really what's important to kids, isn't it? I mean that's what your brother gave you.
Harley: Yes. Yes, he did. But I can't turn the other cheek when I see cruelty and injustice, Dad, okay. I can't do that, if that's where you're going with this little lecture.
Buzz: Damn it! Lately I have noticed there is some value in maintaining the peace.
Harley: Okay, I'll take that into consideration.
Buzz: I'm going to get some fresh air.
Harley: Good.
Gus: Good. Just the man I wanted to see.
Buzz: This is it? So soon?
Gus: This is it. It's over. You won. Phillip caved.
Buzz: What?
Gus: It's all there in black and white.
Buzz: How did this happen?
Gus: It happened because Phillip can't mess with Mother Nature that's why.
Buzz: My restaurant was saved by a bird?
Gus: Yeah. Actually, you see that tree right there? That tree is in the migratory path of a very rare and endangered bird called the nesting warbler if you could believe that.
Buzz: How could I ever repay you for this?
Gus: Oh, hey, you don't have to thank me. Just call the Springfield Wildlife Society. They're the ones who... They're the ones who made this happen, okay. Them, not me.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: No, you're not wrong, JB we do have a connection.
JB: We've only known each other for a few days.
Tammy: It doesn't even matter. I felt close to you right away.
JB: Well, I want to feel even closer.
Tammy: Me too.
JB: I'll go get us those drinks, you still flying sober?
Tammy: I've changed my mind. I'm going to have a rum and coke.
JB: That's my girl!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: You know what? I appreciate your concern for my safety and I love you for it. But why don't you use your heroic energy on someone who needs it.
Sandy: Like who?
Reva: Like Tammy. I was out at the farm earlier and you know, she's out there on her and she was hanging out with this really creepy guy. He was like the anti-Joey.
Sandy: A new guy? Someone you don't know?
Reva: I've never seen him. I don't know what alley she found him in.
Sandy: What's he look like?
Reva: I know he's older than Tammy, tall, dark hair, kind of long, piercing eyes, sullen, and the mouth on this kid.
Sandy: What do you mean by that?
Reva: Well, you know, I can handle teenage rudeness, but this guy had some really dark vibes.
Sandy: Why would Tammy go near a guy like that?

Reva: You know she's been hurting so much since her breakup with Joey. I don't know. I don't know how far it's gone with this creep. But whatever she's doing with him, she's doing it with the wrong guy. (Phone rings) hold on a second, it's Billy.
Sandy: Go ahead. I'll be right back.
Reva: Okay.
Tammy: Hello?
Sandy: Tammy, hi, it's Sandy.
Tammy: What's up, cous?
Sandy: Hey, what's up? Where are you?
Tammy: Out with a friend.
Sandy: Who?
Tammy: No one that you know.
Sandy: Well, how do you know? Maybe I do.
Tammy: What's with the third degree?
Sandy: Okay, Tammy, I'm serious now. I need to know where you are and who you're with.
Tammy: You are worse than Aunt Reva. Got to go, bye.
Sandy: Tammy... Tammy. Where are you? Where are you? Okay, it was loud... music... bar music. Music.
Reva: No, I know that, Billy. But Josh is very hard to get a hold of. Yeah, I know. Wait. Hold on a second, wait, my kid's trying to get away from me.
Sandy: I got to go, bye. Thank you.
Reva: Where? What's going on?
Sandy: Nothing I can't take care of. Bye.
Reva: Billy, can I call you back? I've got to go find out what's going on with my kid. Okay, honey. Bye.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Michelle: Well, first of all, the lighthouse isn't even for sale. And why would you want to buy it? You don't even live here.
Sebastian: Well, that could change. And, besides, this lighthouse has sentimental value for me.
Michelle: Wow. I guess it does.
Sebastian: Is that a yes?
Michelle: You know the lighthouse isn't even going to be worth this much after we're finished the renovations let alone now.
Sebastian: I'm good for it if that's what you're concerned about.
Michelle: No, that's not the problem.
Sebastian: Come on name your terms. We will complete the restoration according to your plans and we will name it after you, Michelle's.
Michelle: (Laughs)
Sebastian: How does that sound?
Michelle: It's tempting.
Sebastian: Yeah.
Michelle: But my answer is still no.
Sebastian: May I ask why?
Michelle: This is my dream, you know, putting this place back together. It has a lot of special meaning to me on a lot of different levels. It's hard for me to explain.
Sebastian: No, no, you don't... You don't have to. I hope I didn't offend you.
Michelle: No, no, not at all, no, really, and it's actually nice to hear some things about my mother from someone other than family.
Sebastian: Well, you know what? If you ever want to talk about Maureen, I'm available.
Michelle: Thanks.
Sebastian: You're welcome. Good luck with the renovations.
Michelle: I'll send you an invite to opening night.
Sebastian: I'll be here.
Michelle: I guess my mother had a secret admirer.
[SCENE_BREAK]
JB: Hey, guys? Guys, come over here. There's someone I want you to meet.
???: What's up, JB? (laughter) How you doing, boy?
JB: What's up?
???: How are you doing?
JB: How's it? Rocko, Jake, this is Tammy.
Jake: What's up, Tammy?
JB: Not bad, huh?
Rocko: And she is fine.
JB: (mumbles) Look, but don't touch while I go get you guys some beers.
Jake: You old enough to be in here?
Tammy: I'm in college. Do you guys go to Springfield U?
Rocko: JB is the chemist. Not us. (Laughter)
Tammy: You seem to know him pretty well.
Jake: Babe, I don't think anybody really knows that guy.

Gus: So get inside, you know, turn on the griddle or chop an onion. Make yourself useful.
Buzz: I think first I'll put out some bird feeders. What do nestling warblers eat?
Gus: Oh, please don't ask me. I don't think they eat much. I hear they're heavy drinkers though. Come on in. I'll make you a drink.
Gus: No, no, it's all right. I... I...
Buzz: Although I know you had nothing to do with this.
Gus: I got to go. Really.
Buzz: Don't you want to break the news to Harley?
Gus: She's in there?
Buzz: She's inside ready to get to the mat for this place.
Gus: Some things don't change.
Buzz: Some things turn on a dime. Maybe you and she will.
Gus: No, not after the way everything went down, you know. No. Just keep my name out of this whole thing, okay.
Buzz: Why?
Gus: It's better. I want her to be happy, yes. I want her to celebrate. I just don't think she needs to have a Spaulding around her. Okay. Enjoy your place.
Harley: I don't believe this.
Gus: It's for real. We're back in business.
Harley: I don't believe this. See. I told you never give up. Oh, Daddy, see, the nesting warbler, I love you! Tell me who did this? Tell me who pulled off this last minute reprieve?
Buzz: Well, I was sworn to secrecy about this, but his first name begins with a G and his last name begins with an A.
Harley: Gus?
Buzz: He handed it to me.
Harley: Gus is here? Gus! Wait.
Harley: You did this.
Gus: I was just the messenger.
Harley: Well, it's got Spaulding lawyer written all over it.
Gus: I'm a pencil pusher these days.
Harley: You're saying that Phillip did this out of the kindness of his heart?

Gus: Well... No actually it's the orn... The ornithological... The bird people, those people and the Environmental Protection Agency. They really put the screws to him, so... that bird, that's a powerful bird in the court.
Harley: And you had nothing to do with this at all?

Gus: Oh, please. When was the last time Phillip ever listened to anything I had to say? I'm happy that Spaulding doesn't have to waste a bunch of money in litigation. That bird, that would've been years in court.
Harley: That's it?
Gus: Yeah. I got to go.
Harley: Sure. Hey, Gus. Thanks.
Gus: Yeah.
Harley: Oh, Daddy, let me do that.
Buzz: He left?
Harley: Yes, he left. But the important thing is the war is over!
Buzz: You start work on the turn the other cheek stuff.
Harley: No, I will. I will.
Buzz: Yeah.
Harley: Hey, the next time I see Phillip, I'll be all about peace and love.
Buzz: Yeah?
Harley: You have my word.
Buzz: Really?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Sandy: I'm sorry to be curt, but have you guys seen Tammy?
Harley: No. Nobody here but us nesting warblers. (Laughs)
Sandy: Excuse me?
Harley: Well, Phillip can't tear down Company because we're in the migratory path of a bird.
Sandy: Oh, oh. You're back in business?
Harley: Yes.
Buzz: You bet.
Sandy: Congratulations. Okay, no Tammy.
Harley: No.
Sandy: Okay.
Buzz: But when you find Tammy, bring her back and your mother and I'll make you some big messy burgers.
Sandy: Got it. All right. Congratulations.
Harley: Okay, Sandy.

Tammy: So, how long have you guys known JB?
Rocko: We're business associates.

Tammy: I was just making small talk.

Tammy: None that you're ever go to see. Let's dance.

Tammy: Hey, where's JB?

Phillip: Here we go. That's my boy. Hey, you know what? I don't like the way we said good-bye yesterday. And that was all my fault, okay. Not yours. I just don't ever want you to be that upset again, all right? Because I love you, Zach. I love you so much. And I always want things to be okay between us, okay? Okay? I got a little surprise for you. Look who's here.
Zach: Teddy!
Phillip: (laughs) Yeah, it's teddy. I know how much you Miss him when we get together. So I thought, you know what? I'm going to go over to your mom's house and get him.
Zach: Thanks, Dad.
Phillip: You're welcome, buddy. I'd do anything for you, son. I want you to have the life that you deserve. Don't ever forget that.

Buzz: If that's Zach, tell him he's got his job back if he wants it.
Harley: Hello? Yes, this is Harley Cooper. Wait, wait, wait. Slow down. What? What? No, I will be there. I will be right there.
Buzz: What is it?
Harley: I've got to go. I've got to go.
Buzz: Where?
Harley: Home!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: I don't want to dance anymore. I'm going to go look for JB
Sandy: Hey, man, I'm sorry to bother you. Excuse me. I was wondering... It's very important that I find someone. Have you seen this guy around?
Bartender: Yeah, yeah, he was in here, but he took off. He was with some girl or something?
Sandy: What girl? What did she look like?
Bartender: She was blonde, great body.
Sandy: Under age?
Bartender: What are you a cop or something? You her boyfriend?
Sandy: No, I'm neither. Don't worry. Which way did they go?

Sandy: Thanks.

Danny: You gave your mother's good buddy the boot, huh?
Michelle: You may not be smiling when I tell you what Sebastian offered me for this place.
Danny: Oh, no. God, no. I don't want to know. I don't want to know. Really, I'm just glad you turned him down.
Michelle: You didn't like the guy did you?
Danny: Uh-uh. Instant distrust.
Michelle: Why?
Danny: Ex-mobster's intuition.
Michelle: The cut of the suit--hair gel.
Danny: Bad guys always wear black, Michelle.
Michelle: Tell me about your interview.
Danny: It was fine. I don't think it's going to work I don't think it's going to work out, though. Too many late nights, weekends. I can't do that to Robbie.
Michelle: Well, something better will come along.

Danny: Yeah, I know. I know it will. I'm not worried. (phone rings) I'm sorry. I meant to turn this off. But let me just see who it is. I've got to take this. Hello? Speaking. Mm-hmm. Yeah. Tomorrow? Yeah. Okay. Uh-huh. Okay. Sure. All right, I'll be there. Thank you. Thanks a lot. I'll see you tomorrow. Right. Bye. You're not going to believe this. I have an interview for a job in New York.
Michelle: New York?

Danny: Tomorrow. Yeah. Apparently someone that I interviewed with, like last month, forwarded my name to a venture capitalist. He's based in New York, but he's looking for somebody to start-up an office branch here in Springfield.
Michelle: Danny, that's amazing.
Danny: Yeah.
Michelle: See, you didn't even need that stupid Towers job.
Danny: Well, you're right. But I got to...
Michelle: When are you going?
Danny: I got to go now. Tonight. Because there's a ticket waiting for me at the airport and I've just got to pack. I guess I got to get Robbie situated at Rick and Mel's.
Michelle: I'll take care of Robbie.
Danny: Yeah.
Michelle: You just get to the airport. Drop him off here on your way.
Danny: You're sure?
Michelle: Yeah, I'm positive. We'll have a great time.
Danny: Okay. All right. Thanks. So I'll call you on my way over.
Michelle: Okay.
Danny: Okay. Bye.
Michelle: I'll miss you.
Danny: I'll miss you. Bye. Keep your fingers crossed.
Michelle: They already are.
Danny: Bye.
Michelle: Bye.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Sebastian: Santos is on his way to New York and Michelle Bauer is all alone. Just the way I want her.

Zach: Does mommy know teddy's here?
Phillip: She'll be finding out soon enough.

Gus: I am the man that you love. I am the man that you were going to marry. I would lie my life down on the line for you and the children and you know that. You used him against that same woman and you make him hurt even more!
